dcterms:creator: A. Krizhevsky
G. Hinton
dcterms:description: The CIFAR10 dataset contains 10 classes of images with 6,000 images per class and 60,000 images in total. Among the 60,000 images, 50,000 ones are used for training and the rest 10,000 ones are used for testing. All the images have three-color channels and the image size is 32 Ã— 32.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10 dataset

dcterms:description: CIFAR10+ is an augmented version of CIFAR10 obtained by randomly flipping each training image.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10+ dataset

dcterms:creator: Ling Shao
Di Wu
Xuelong Li
dcterms:description: The CIFAR100 dataset has the same number of training images and testing images as CIFAR10 but contains 100 classes instead of 10. Each image has two labels: a fine label indicating the specific class and a coarse label indicating the super-class.
dcterms:title: CIFAR100 dataset

dcterms:description: CIFAR10++ is a larger version of CIFAR10 obtained by padding 4 pixels on each side and then randomly cropping and flipping on the fly.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10++ dataset
